medical_history.chief_complaint: Continued epigastric and right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain started at 8:30 PM and initially began in the RUQ before moving to the epigastric area. It is described as a deep pressure that has not relented. The patient has begun to experience emesis, non-bloody, non-bilious, associated with pain. She had three episodes of post-prandial biliary colic pain lasting 3 hours over the past two months, usually relieved with time and ibuprofen.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Past medical history includes gallstones. Previous surgical history includes excision of a lesion on the left neck.
